text: John Gorton (30 January 1821 – 2 September 1900)Obituary The Times (London, England), Wednesday, Sep 05, 1900; pg. 4; Issue 36239 was an Anglican Archdeacon in India in the mid 19th century. Gorton was born at Tickhill, and was educated at Wadham College, Oxford, where he matriculated in 1839, graduating B.A. in 1842 and M.A. in 1845. He was ordained in 1844. After a curacy at Harrow-on-the-Hill he went out with the Eccles Establishment to India, rising to be Archdeacon of Madras from 1871 to 1875.Crockford's Clerical Directory 1898 p537: London, Horace Cox, 1898 ==References== Category:19th-century Anglican priests Category:Eccles Establishment people Category:People from Tickhill Category:Alumni of Trinity College, Cambridge Category:1821 births Category:1900 deaths Category:Archdeacons of Madras Category:Clergy from Yorkshire
title: John Gorton (priest)
